translated: The Conditional Relations in Accordance with the True Idea (Paṭṭhāna)

original: 17.22. Vipākattika, Kusalattika🔽Vipākadhammadhammaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca navipākadhammadhammo nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Vipākadhammadhammaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca navipākadhammadhammo naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: vipāka attika kusala attika  vipāka dhamma dhammam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  vipāka dhamma dhammam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Section on Ripening, the Section on the Wholesome🔽With a ripening-resultant idea as condition there arises a non-ripening-resultant wholesome idea, a condition by root-cause condition. (In brief.) There are three under root-cause condition, three under predominance condition, … and so on as in § 111 up to … three under non-hindrance condition.🔽With a ripening-resultant unwholesome idea as condition there arises a non-ripening-resultant unwholesome idea, a condition by root-cause condition. (In brief.) There are three under root-cause condition, three under predominance condition, … and so on as in § 111 up to … three under non-hindrance condition.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo naabyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam abyākatam dhammam paccayā na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a neither-ripening-nor-non-ripening-resultant indeterminate idea as condition there arises a neither-ripening-nor-non-ripening-resultant indeterminate idea, a condition by root-cause condition. (In brief.) There are three under root-cause condition, … and so on as in § 111 up to … three under non-hindrance condition.
